questions.question: What is the primary goal of requirements discovery?
options: To write the final code for the system
To design the system's user interface
To identify or extract system problems and solution requirements from users
To test the system after implementation
questions.correctAnswerText: To identify or extract system problems and solution requirements from users

questions.question: What is a functional requirement?
options: Something the information system must do
A property or quality the system must have
A constraint on system development time
A description of the system's hardware
questions.correctAnswerText: Something the information system must do

questions.question: Which of the following is a nonfunctional requirement?
options: The system must process customer orders
The system must respond within 2 seconds
The system must generate monthly reports
The system must allow user login
questions.correctAnswerText: The system must respond within 2 seconds

questions.question: What is an Ishikawa diagram used for?
options: To design database tables
To track project schedules
To identify, explore, and depict problems and their causes
To model system use cases
questions.correctAnswerText: To identify, explore, and depict problems and their causes

questions.question: Which fact-finding technique involves collecting a representative sample of documents and forms?
options: Interviewing
Observation
Sampling
Questionnaires

questions.question: What is a key advantage of using questionnaires in fact-finding?
options: Allows observation of body language
Provides high response rate automatically
Can be answered quickly and allows anonymity
Guarantees all questions will be answered
questions.correctAnswerText: Can be answered quickly and allows anonymity

questions.question: What is the most important and frequently used fact-finding technique?
options: Questionnaires
Observation
Prototyping
Interviews

questions.question: In an interview, what is an open-ended question?
options: A question with predefined answer choices
A question that allows the interviewee to respond freely
A question that restricts answers to yes or no
A question about system performance
questions.correctAnswerText: A question that allows the interviewee to respond freely

questions.question: What does 'proxemics' refer to in communication?
options: The tone of voice used
The content of the message
The relationship between people and the space around them
The use of technical jargon
questions.correctAnswerText: The relationship between people and the space around them

questions.question: What is the purpose of discovery prototyping?
options: To replace the final system
To write user documentation
To build a small-scale model to discover or verify user requirements
To train end-users after implementation
questions.correctAnswerText: To build a small-scale model to discover or verify user requirements

questions.question: Who typically acts as a facilitator in a JRP session?
options: System sponsor
End-user
A trained person who guides the session
IT programmer
questions.correctAnswerText: A trained person who guides the session

questions.question: What is a key benefit of Joint Requirements Planning (JRP)?
options: It eliminates the need for testing
It reduces user involvement
It actively involves users and management, reducing development time
It automates system coding
questions.correctAnswerText: It actively involves users and management, reducing development time

questions.question: Which of the following is a guideline for effective observation?
options: Interrupt the worker to ask questions
Focus only on trivial activities
Keep a low profile and take notes
Assume you understand the process without verification
questions.correctAnswerText: Keep a low profile and take notes

questions.question: What is a fixed-format questionnaire?
options: A questionnaire with only essay questions
A questionnaire with predefined answer choices
A questionnaire used only in interviews
A questionnaire without any questions
questions.correctAnswerText: A questionnaire with predefined answer choices

questions.question: What does requirements management involve?
options: Writing system code
Designing the database
Managing changes to requirements over the project lifecycle
Conducting final user training
questions.correctAnswerText: Managing changes to requirements over the project lifecycle
